title: Ariel Winter shows legs in sexy floral pink mini dress with blazer combo at Girl Up #GirlHero Awards
text:
She is miles away from the mousy girl who first appeared on Modern Family ten years ago.

Ariel Winter, who first found fame playing the youngest Dunphy Alex on the groundbreaking family sitcom, looked very much her grown up self on Sunday, when she attended the 2nd Annual Girl Up #GirlHero Awards at the Beverly Wilshire Four Seasons Hotel in Beverly Hills, California.

Winter, 21, chose a smart black blazer with bejeweled lapels for the event celebrating gender equality and female changemakers, along with a sexy cleavage-revealing floral bustier and bright pink mini skirt.

Little girl no more: Ariel Winter looked very much her grown up self on Sunday, when she attended the 2nd Annual Girl Up #GirlHero Awards in Beverly Hills

The sleeves of Winter's jacket featured stain paneling, but the focus was on the brunette's shapely legs, which poured from her short pink mini skirt.

She wore cute white heeled Mat Jane sandals, and carried a matching white purse with gold handle and a poof of ostrich-style feathers.

The Sofia The First starlet let her gorgeous raven tresses fall down on her shoulders, and she wore a beautiful shade of pink eye shadow to match her skirt.

To complete her look, Ariel sported a deep crimson manicure, and wore some simple jewelry in her ears and on her hands.

Stylish and playful: Winter chose a smart black blazer with bejeweled lapels for the event, along with a sexy cleavage-revealing floral bustier and bright pink mini skirt

The sighting is Ariel's first public appearance since confirming, just days ago, her split from live-in beau Levi Meaden after nearly three years together.

She was also spotted last week on a date with another man, yet to be identified.

The Girl Up #GirlHero Awards were held Sunday in honor of International Day of the Girl, in celebration of young women activists and achievements toward making gender equality a reality.

Leggy lady: The focus was on the brunette's shapely legs, which poured from her short pink mini skirt

This year’s luncheon was emceed by Julianne Hough and is honoring Cara Delevingne, Kate Hudson, Jameela Jamil and specific Girl Up girl changemakers.

According to its website, Girl Up is 'a global movement of empowered young women leaders who defend gender equality' utilizing leadership development training.

The organization was founded by the United Nations Foundation in 2010.
